section.section: Subject to the provisions of this subsection, a student who has completed at least 80 hours of training at a school of barbering may practice barbering, without a license, at the school.

A student may practice barbering under this subsection only:
in the course of the practical work required as part of the training of the student;
while the student is under the direct supervision of a teacher who meets the requirements established by the Department of Education for public school programs or the Maryland Higher Education Commission for private school programs; and
if the individual to whom a service is to be provided agrees to the service after being informed that a student in training is to provide the service.

Subject to the provisions of this subsection, a student who has completed at least 850 hours of training at a school of barbering may practice barbering, without a license, in a:
hospital;
nursing home; or
correctional facility that does not house a barber school.
